summary.text:
This bill appropriates for any period during which interim or full-year appropriations for FY2018 are not in effect such sums as are necessary to administer and provide benefits and services to veterans, dependents, and survivors under specified veterans' benefits laws, including those concerning:

  • compensation for service-connected disability or death,
  • dependency and indemnity compensation for service-connected deaths,
  • pension for non-service-connected disability or death or for service,
  • benefits for children of certain veterans,
  • specially adapted housing for disabled veterans,
  • burial benefits,
  • certain educational assistance programs,
  • training and rehabilitation for veterans with service-connected disabilities, and
  • automobiles and adaptive equipment for certain disabled veterans and members of the Armed Forces.

Such funds shall be available until the earliest of: (1) enactment of an appropriation for any such purpose, (2) enactment of the applicable regular or continuing appropriations resolution or other bill without any appropriation for such purpose, or (3) January 1, 2019.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
